description: This module aims to provide a broad understanding of Singaporeâ€™s unique healthcare landscape, evolution, financing, goal toward social health integration and burden of disease. The students will learn theories of health behavior, models and framework for practice in health social work.  Social work in healthcare will be examined in the continuum of primary, acute and intermediate and long-term care (ILTC).  The students will gain insights into the impact of illness on individuals and their families.  It aims to cover specialized topics such as chronic illnesses, acute and trauma, mental health, family violence, medical ethics, palliative and end of life care.
title: Social Work in Healthcare Settings
